list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: an even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: she lost her balance before falling
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cô mất thăng bằng trước khi rơi

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a condition in which different elements are equal or in the correct proportions.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: try to keep a balance between work and relaxation
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cố gắng giữ cân bằng giữa công việc và thư giãn

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: an apparatus for weighing, especially one with a central pivot, beam, and a pair of scales.
a predominating weight or amount; the majority.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the balance of opinion was that work was more important than leisure
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: sự cân bằng của ý kiến là công việc quan trọng hơn là giải trí

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a figure representing the difference between credits and debits in an account; the amount of money held in an account.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he accumulated a healthy balance with the savings bank
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Ông tích lũy một sự cân bằng lành mạnh với ngân hàng tiết kiệm

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: keep or put (something) in a steady position so that it does not fall.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: a mug that she balanced on her knee
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: một cốc mà cô ấy cân bằng trên đầu gối của cô ấy

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: offset or compare the value of (one thing) with another.
compare debits and credits in (an account), typically to ensure that they are equal.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the law requires the council to balance its books each year
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Luật pháp yêu cầu Hội đồng cân bằng sách của mình mỗi năm
